radiographic_examinations.findings: Two adjacent masses (2 cm by 2 cm and 1 cm by 1.5 cm) in the left occipital and posterior parietal regions, mass effect on the left occipital horn, abnormal T2-weighted and FLAIR signal hyperintensity extending through the splenium of the corpus callosum.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On the second day, MRI showed two heterogeneous enhancing lesions in the left occipital lobe (2.2 cm by 1.8 cm and 1.1 cm by 1.4 cm) with extensive surrounding edema. Follow-up MRI three months after surgery showed irregular enhancement around the surgical cavity and mass effect. At 18 months post-surgery, MRI showed reduced enhancement in the left occipital lobe, with no active tumor despite mass effect.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mark notably decreased enhancement at 18 months post-surgery.
